ygData.subject: Re: Cheats, bannable offenses, and the like
ygData.msgSnippet: I just feel like were all in the same community and by notifying other cheaters or those interested in cheating the possible downfalls of partaking in a
ygData.messageBody:
I just feel like were all in the same "community" and by notifying other
"cheaters" or those interested in "cheating" the possible downfalls of
partaking in a particular cheat, were in essence helping them out. If you
for some reason frown on this, then you can quickly just delete the msg.


-----Original Message-----
From: Moe Drippins <ug@...>
To: eqcheats@onelist.com <eqcheats@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, August 16, 1999 5:29 PM
Subject: [EQCheats] Cheats, bannable offenses, and the like


>From: Moe Drippins <ug@...>
>
>
>All,
>
>It seems every time that someone posts a cheat that might be frowned
>upon by the GM's, numerous people feel the need to chime in that it
>might be frowned upon by the GM's.
>
>I know you all mean well, but this *IS* a cheat list, and it's a bit
>tiring to get 5 emails about the dangers of doing "X" for every mail
>that we get about "X".
>
>Might I suggest that the owner of this list put that disclaimer at the
>bottom of the list or make it part of the "Hello, welcome to EQ
>cheats..." subscription notice?
>
>Just one man's opinion.
>
>--
>Frake, Rodcet Nife
>Iilii, Vallon Zek
>
>--------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>
>Create a list for FRIENDS & FAMILY...
>...and YOU can WIN $100 to Amazon.com. For details, go to
>http://www.onelist.com/info/onereachsplash3.html
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>For more information on how to join the best roleplaying game on the net
goto www.everquest.com
